textBeforeTable: Table 12-3 Columns in the DBA_SA_AUDIT_OPTIONS View The DBA_SA_AUDIT_OPTIONS view contains the following columns: This section describes the view that displays the Oracle Label Security auditing options and privileges. 12.3.4 Examining Audit Options with the DBA_SA_AUDIT_OPTIONS View If you try to enable an audit option that has already been set, or if you try to disable an audit option that has not been set, then Oracle Label Security processes the statement without indicating an error. An attempt to specify an invalid option results in an error message. NOAUDIT parameters and options that you set apply only to subsequent sessions, not to current sessions. then auditing will continue to be performed on the privileged operations (such as WRITEDOWN). SA_AUDIT_ADMIN.NOAUDIT ('HR'); Auditing of privileged operations must be specified explicitly. If you run NOAUDIT with no options, the Oracle Label Security will nonetheless continue to audit privileged operations. For example, if auditing is enabled and you enter does not reverse the auditing that was set for SCOTT explicitly in the first call. So, auditing continues to be performed on SCOTT. In this way, even if NOAUDIT is set for all users, Oracle Label Security still audits any users for whom auditing was explicitly set. SA_AUDIT_ADMIN.NOAUDIT ('HR'); In this case, a subsequent call to NOAUDIT with no users
